Pre-Game Insights: England will return to Bridgetown, the venue of their first-ever ICC trophy win in 2010.
England comes into the tournament with a 2-0 win over Pakistan, with Jofra Archer making his comeback after over a year on the sidelines.
Scotland's top three batters look in form, but they need better performances from their middle-order.
Scotland will look to attack England's middle-order with spin, targeting Will Jacks, Moeen Ali, Harry Brook, Liam Livingstone, and Sam Curran.
Scotland has not bowled first in just three of their 17 T20Is since January 2022, and each of their 10 wins in this period have come while batting first.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will be Scotland's first T20I in the Caribbean.
There's increasing help for spinners in the second innings here, and teams prefer to bat first in day games.
The weather in the leadup to the tournament has been wet, which could have adversely affected the pitch preparations.
Rain is predicted for the match day.
Others: England's captain Jos Buttler downplayed the pressure of being defending champions, stating it's a 'nice title' to have but not adding pressure.
Richie Berrington, Scotland's captain, expressed excitement for the tournament, noting the opportunity for all teams to perform well.
The match is scheduled for 4 June 2024 at 10:30 AM local time, 8:00 PM IST, and 02:30 PM GMT.
